Go ahead and try to sue riot right now for this, see how that turns out.


With most things in life, you will sign something that will make it where said company cannot be held as liable, people will be mad... all because they didn't read the ToS and agreed then got upset.



But if you feel you've been done so wrong and it is so unlawful, you're welcome to take legal action against riot; don't expect the best outcome for yourself though.

I was in a premade lobby with a few rioters, and my game wouldn't open and I got a directX issue. Guess what? I got hit with Leaverbuster for their remake.

It doesn't matter WHAT caused it, or what happened... You left the game, and if you took a minute to read what I already explained about there being zero way of checking the authenticity of DC's.... 

Riot do not need to baby sit you, if you are aware you have connectivity issues or technical issues, it is up to you as the player to get in contact with riot.

Riot cannot and most likely won't do anything, because if they contact you about it "oh sorry Im having connectivity issues with my isp" will be used by every kid and his dog when they raged out and alt+f4'd their game.

I understand that you may have client or connectivity issues, however you are still leaving your team 4v5 until you return, if you ever do.

It can be frustrating, but this is little in the way of making your team feel better knowing they were not forced to play 4v5 for nothing. 

Do you think its fair to make your team 4v5? Would you be happy if someone did it to you? That's the point of leaverbuster, it does not discriminate against anything, because its just so easy to unplug that ethernet cable, or to power down your machine that it cannot differentiate well enough as to why you disconnected and make it fair on people who would abuse the system.

is there really no way to compensate a 4 or less vs5????
a pause?
more time to return?
a active support that contacts you after multiple leaves/afks before an actual punishment? to help you with client and connectivity issues?
a punishment based on whether they did or did not reconnect and if the match was won or not, a bit consideration goes a long way with said player reconnected.

bugsplat, client malfunctions and errors should be filtered out since the client should hold a log on it O.o
power outages can be proven since they get registered by alot of companies, a malfunction by router/provider is tricky i guess.

but why is that weird ''I Agree'' there?
can't they add that to the ToS??????
truth be told no one can actually agree to it, since issues might arise in the future O.o
